Our Aspiring Leaders programme is open to any #nurse who:
‚úÖ works in a Community or Primary Care setting 
‚úÖ aspires to take the next step in their #leadership career. 
Find out more and apply on our website by 23.59 on 7 September 2022.   (7/8)
https://t.co/Sq9eTQfXRP
Based on feedback from participants, as many as 50% of those undertaking our programmes move to a more responsible or more senior role before the end of the programme. #QNILeaders   (6/8)
We offer personal support throughout your progress with us, including mentorship from a matched mentor after a personal needs assessment is undertaken with you.   (5/8)

All our leadership programmes are bespoke and personalised for the individuals taking part, and the particular challenges and opportunities that are most relevant within community healthcare at the time.   (4/8)

We currently offer two different Leadership programmes for #CommunityNurses: 
1‚É£ Aspiring Leaders Programme that is open to any nurse.  
2‚É£ Executive Nurse Leadership Programme for those nurses already working at a senior level.   (3/8)
Our Leadership programmes are open to all #nurses working in the community and primary care setting, including adult social care and care home nurses. #QNILeaders   (2/8)

üßµAbout the QNI Leadership programmes for nurses working in the community. #QNILeaders

Read the full report on #DistrictNurse education 2020-21 on our website.
https://t.co/qY2v6Aeuq2
4‚É£ Educators expressed concerns over the future of central funding of the DNSPQ.
3‚É£ There are 41 Higher Education Institutions registered to deliver the DNSPQ programme with theNMC and 38 of these are currently offering the programme. 37 universities responded to the audit.

2‚É£ 710 new students were enrolled on the DNSPQ for the 2021/22 academic year. This represents a decrease of 13% on the previous year, though as above this number will also have been affected by the Covid-19 pandemic.

1‚É£ 709 nurses gained the #DNSPQ in the 2020/21 academic year; this represents an increase of 28% from the previous year, although the number is affected by those who chose to postpone or delay courses due to the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic.

üßµOur latest review of #DistrictNurse education is now available on our website. 

The report covers all four countries of the United Kingdom and summarises the results of an audit of District Nurse education in the UK during the academic year 2020/21.

More than 10 visits per staff member per day is associated with more deferral or delegation of more complex care to unqualified staff - @alisonleary1 #woundcare @LRmedUK

Wound care can be left undone, deferred or delegated if workload becomes unmanageable in the community. This causes 'moral distress' to staff and is a trigger for people leaving the profession, says @alisonleary1 speaking at @TheQNI's wound care event @LRmedUK

@ParishNursingUK @CrystalOldman Delighted you were able to join us!
'And a huge thank you to @f_barlas the Events Manager and mastermind of the #qni2021 conference' @CrystalOldman https://t.co/j1iAfm330P

'Thank you for coming, thank you to the 50 speakers who spoke at this #qni2021 conference, we've had more than 2000 people engage with us over the 5 days. We must keep learning from the people that we serve.' @CrystalOldman https://t.co/3ryVBiLyuJ

Thank you @MichaelRosenYes 'You are truly inspirational, but you continue to approach this with such an amazing sense of humour. We've learnt so much from you.' @CrystalOldman #qni2021 https://t.co/T6QeDsb4n4
'You must harness the gratitude of patients. ' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021
'Owning your own frailty, you can't dump it on others, whingeing, or being the 'kvetch', you can't do that, you have to live in the now.' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021

'I'm still re-learning and the difficult thing is there are 3 identities: before I was ill, when I was ill, and now. You are who you are but you shouldn't let [the illness] define you.' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021
'I describe myself as the 'dybbuk' (Jewish ghost) of Muswell Hill at the moment' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021

'The burden that you folks carry, it's not just the labour or care you do, every moment you care, you may have that person taken away, it's a big burden, this takes time to churn through the mind.' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021
'I was so overwhelmed with the care I received, it was incredible.' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021
' I know that somebody pumped me full of drugs, but it doesn't mean I understand it, when I see the film of me I look like a cadaver. I don't have any memory of it.' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021
'I was discharged 3 months after I'd gone into hospital. My trachy scar wouldn't heal however. ' #qni2021 @MichaelRosenYes
'Many Different Kinds of Love' @michaelrosenyes amazing book,  A story of life, death and the NHS https://t.co/woBXpvKEno #qni2021
'My oxygen saturation was at 58%. I was whisked to hospital, into intensive care, where I thrived for 24 hours and then I dipped and put into an induced coma for 40 days.' @MichaelRosenYes #qni2021

@MichaelRosenYes speaking at #qni2021 'I got #covid, which felt like flu, temperature, but then my breath did get short.  I would've died that night, if it wasn't for my wife seeing me and saying I looked awful'

Welcome to Writer and #NationalTreasure @MichaelRosenYes to #qni2021 conference and today's session: 'Many Different Kinds of Love.' Michael has written a book on his experience of recovering from #covid: https://t.co/woBXpvKEno https://t.co/gBE7ZVNCmn
Thank you @stillillcorona1 for your very inspiring session today, very moving and insightful! #qni2021 https://t.co/2B3ec8pIpG

@stillillcorona1 the corona diary on instagram: #qni2021 https://t.co/eEoMRUbtq3
@stillillcorona1 'I decided to buy an ipad and draw what was happening to me' #qni2021 https://t.co/OWg9X5ygjC
@stillillcorona1 recounting her experience with #LongCovid #qni2021 https://t.co/V32kcDHXIn
Monique Jackson, Artist, #LongCovid expert, Public Speaker, @stillillcorona1 speaking of her experience with #LongCovid #qni2021 https://t.co/zy4McFi056
Thank you to #ExtraordinaryQN Jo-Anne Wilson from British Legion Care Home for a wonderfully inspiring session. #qni2021 https://t.co/vyre6Acj0y

'Dignity was difficult, as the undertakers came in full PPE even if the person hadn't died of #covid, which felt quite undignified and didn't feel good for us.' Jo-Anne Wilson British Legion Care Home #qni2021
Jo Anne Wilson from British Legion Care Home #qni2021, the Challenges during #Covid https://t.co/7InQcfYfda
'You don't want to have that conversation when the person is deteriorating.' Jo-Anne Wilson  #qni2021 https://t.co/aWG6PqzJ13
'We aim to have everyone have a good death.' Jo-Anne Wilson from British Legion Care Home #qni2021 https://t.co/ilUuJTS4Dp
Jo-Anne Wilson from 'British Legion Care Home' at #qni2021 https://t.co/AfH87x5Ywa
Jo-Anne Wilson from the British Legion Care Home, speaking at #qni2021 'End of Life Good Practice Initiative in Care Homes' https://t.co/B565WoQUyY
Standing ovation in British Sign Language for @SalliPilcherNHS at #qni2021 Thank you for your moving and inspiring session on your journey with #LongCovid https://t.co/ZvCqJ6P5jV
'We need to make sure practitioners know of the signs of #longcovid, we need to give long covid sufferers hope.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021

'I know I'm making progress, it still feels like a long distance marathon. To you all suffering from this: be open and honest, ask for help early, make adjustments for your staff and team. Keep an activity diary.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021

'My sleep's improved thanks to the meditation. I struggle to pace, but I learn to live with the symptoms of long fatigue, I walk at lunchtime when I can. I continue to post my journey on social media.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021
'I've swum right through the wind, in the snow and in the ice, the only complaint we have is the lake in summer is not cold enough.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021
'I started to be more honest on social media, I opened up about my #longcovid story about the bad days and the shit days and there were many of those.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021
'Pacing. I had been pushing myself hard, but what I should have done all along, is pace, pace. pace.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021

'I posted on FB did any of my friends fancy wild swimming? And we did, fast forward 14 months, we've swam 3 times a week, through the winter. The benefits of wild water swimming: mindfulness, nerve calming and most importantly it works for me.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021
'Tai Chi has many health benefits and has helped my recovery, so has meditation.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021
'I read as much as I could. But it was trying to piece together a Perspex puzzle, trying to piece together things you can't see.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021

'I was getting worse rather than better. I didn't want to be seen as not coping. I didn't want to fail. I was yet to learn about pacing. I thought recovery would come from pushing myself.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021
'I wear an emotional mask most days, I push myself every day to do normal things. I see pictures of those months and see smiling pictures of me, but it's not me.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021
'I struggled at work, I was breathless, fatigue, anxious, emotional, exhausted, feeling very vulnerable. Looking back, I shouldn't have been at work' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021

'By day 7 I felt like I'd been hit by a bus, I was breathless and had joint pain. I was isolated I was scared. I know now with 5 or more symptoms in the first week I was likely to go on to develop #LongCovid.' @SalliPilcherNHS #qni2021

Welcome to @SalliPilcherNHS to #qni2021 conference speaking about her experience with #LongCovid, 'Whilst I wasn't the fittest woman in the world, I did lots of sports, and was an active mum to my teenage son.' https://t.co/Lt4SLdHtAm

@HeatherFinlay9 speaking at #qni2021 'We have 3 key strategic drivers: 1. Health and Wellbeing 2026; 2. Nursing and Midwifery Task Group and 3. Rebuilding Health and Social Care Services. To read the Health and Wellbeing 2026 report: https://t.co/QX0dzf4peZ https://t.co/Zlj3267l7U
'We have to show that nursing has expertise.' @alisonleary1 #qni2021

'Dealing with micro aggression is very important. We can see that in bullying and racism and sexism, it all needs to be tackled. We need to think about how we can be good bystanders for each other.' @alisonleary1 #qni2021
'Nurses are the Air Traffic Controllers of healthcare.' @alisonleary1 #qni2021

'This winter is going to be tough. Looking after yourself and looking after your colleagues is hugely important.' @CNOEngland #qni2021

'When you speak, you are a vehicle, not for just yourself, and btw there's nothing wrong with you getting praise for what you do, but you are speaking for patients too.' @suzannecgordon #qni2021

'You have an amazing system of community nursing.  I spent a day with @alderton_liz shadowing her. You go into the homes of people who have cancer, who have all kinds of problems and it was extraordinary to watch this nurse in action doing home care.' @suzannecgordon #qni2021

'This project was designed to articulate the kind of work that nurses to and to overcome this silencing of the self and covering the critical important work that nurses do no matter where they are. ' @suzannecgordon #qni2021

'I'm a kind person, I can be nice and caring. I would kill your patients in a matter of hours! You want somebody who's learned on the job, who's gone to school (university) not just somebody who's nice and kind!' @suzannecgordon #qni2021

'The workshops focused on what nurses did, the skills they had. I wanted to help nurses talk in lay language so people would understand them, and to help them overcome their tendency to minimise their work.' @suzannecgordon #qni2021

'Nurses have been taught not to talk about their work, to be silent and silence each other. That's one of the biggest problems and this project reverses this dynamic' @suzannecgordon #qni2021 https://t.co/JwWPRKefTl

'Nurses must explain that the system doesn't work without them. It's absolutely critical to have every single nurse on message about helping people understand about the critical importance of community nursing.' #qni2021 @suzannecgordon

'Getting nurses to talk is kind of like getting people to vote or be vaccinated. Because nurses have been fed a message: you should say little and do a lot and just soldier on.' @suzannecgordon #qni2021

'It's the mentality you go in, be a ferret, do not give in. Sometimes you can wear people down, kill them with kindness. Put them in such a corner, they can't say no to you. It's the human skills that really matter.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021

'There's a lot of money out there but not being spent on the right things. You've got persuade hearts and minds, that'll bring the money in. Go outside the NHS. There's nothing stopping you bringing in the voluntary sector into your space.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021

'These kids grew their own vegetables, created food. Saw an aubergine for the first time. These kids were talking at a packed conference, extraordinary. Once you unleash the creativity in children...' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021 https://t.co/WF0uC7xZZm
'You want to die at home, you as nurses can make that happen. It's that coordinated holistic continued care.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021
The nursing team at @Bromley_by_Bow Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021 https://t.co/DdG7dWoVlm
'Who's the nurse?' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021 https://t.co/gItZ7xBz7N
'You are the partner with the patient. Helping them to work out what matters to them rather than what's the matter with them.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021
'Always be suspicious of those saying to you, 'give me a business plan' most often it's a 'no' from bureaucrats.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021
'Smell is really important, how often do you ever experience smell being given importance in an NHS setting? Or sound? The sound of water is very relaxing.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021

Before and after - look at the curving path, designed to encourage 'meandering' in Tower Hamlets. There is no NHS sign up, it needs to feel like it belongs to the people.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021 https://t.co/bq7nBz1QyC
'You have a key role, as the person who brings people together, you are the centre of people's lives and are critical to community cohesion.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021
'People queueing in Tower Hamlets to make use of the food banks during covid - shocking in the 5th richest country in the world.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021 https://t.co/dIWERz8yEl
'A key role of nursing is to challenge issues in relation to diversity. If you don't deal with these inequalities, you won't deal with it with patients either.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021

' I recommend McDonald's to my patients, as it's the healthier option. You might find this difficult to believe, but this is the reality for a lot of children in Tower Hamlets and in the UK.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021
'If you fast forward, would you have designed community nursing and primary care, that only has GPs on it's board?' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021

' The younger generation has been the most sacrificed during #covid. They will have to pick up the pieces, if you're passionate about preventional health, think deeply about this idea about a nurse in every school, that health becomes the driving force in every school.' #qni2021
'A full time nurse on the governing board in every school, backlash: 1. from teachers who say, we don't have time, 2. short of 40,000 nurses in this country.' #qni2021 Professor Sir Sam Everington

'Is my child going to be happy and healthy at school? Yet where's the focus for that in governing bodies? Our vision is a school nurse in every school. And why would you not have somebody who's consistently thinking about the health of the children?' Professor Everington #qni2021

'If you look at the stats around kids it's very grim. 40% of 11 year olds are now obese for example. There is an absolute crisis in health care. Schools have become incubators for long term conditions.' Professor Sir Sam Everington #qni2021
Professor Sir Sam Everington speaking at #qni2021 'A School Nurse in Every School' https://t.co/UBkdcxzvn0
Thank you @ronkeadejolu #qni2021 https://t.co/I456W4Vf4v
'No digital transformation without community nurses' @ronkeadejolu #qni2021 https://t.co/79ckLU2sqc
@ronkeadejolu 'Do get involved, we want to bring the amazing work of community nurses out in the open including your digital journeys. You need to be seen and heard.' #qni2021 https://t.co/3itxgB9227

'We need inspirational leaders across community nursing, we need to break that glass ceiling and level up and make that culture shift. We need to harness the talent of nurses who are at the front line to tell us about their innovations, no talent should be wasted.' @ronkeadejolu https://t.co/dLd5alB2EE
'Making sure community nursing is firmly on the map when it comes to digital transformation.' @ronkeadejolu #qni2021 Some misconceptions below: https://t.co/Qc58WhTsvY
'I think it's undeniable we have digital talent and in abundance in community nurses.' @ronkeadejolu #qni2021 https://t.co/RpuBD0ymi2
'I saw first hand how patients who I only thought had a few days to live, I saw them walk out smiling. It speaks to the amazing work of our community nurses.' @ronkeadejolu #qni2021
'5 clear workstreams, about increasing the impact of digital nurse leadership. What good looks like for nursing.' @ronkeadejolu at #qni2021 https://t.co/KwbIUj9sGM
'The power of digitised health is the data must flow seamlessly so that we can provide a more tailored experience for our users and patients.' @ronkeadejolu at #qni2021 https://t.co/tai5YV9AGR
@ronkeadejolu speaking at #qni2021 'NHSX exists to drive the digital transformation of health and care' https://t.co/mF8YiJdFZg
Saying thank you to @JonAshworth for an inspiring hope-filled inducing session #qni2021 https://t.co/NDRfYzpKwz

@crystaloldman speaking at #qni2021: 'Nearly 350 people at our virtual conference today, and they are saying that you are giving us hope. So that's an amazing thing you have done, thank you @jonashworth'

'We are all immensely proud of the NHS, but there are times we try and sweep these problems under the carpet. The senior management of the NHS have so few people from ethnic minority communities for example. These endemic inequalities need to be tackled. @JonAshworth #qni2021
'We need proper facilities for adults with learning disabilities and a proper workforce. It's quite disgraceful we are failing some of these very vulnerable people. @JonAshworth #qni2021

'Caring responsibilities are disproportionally falling on women, which means women in their 50s being forced out of the labour market, no guarantee they will get the carers allowance. Caring is a very tiring job to do, they need proper support and respite.' @jonashworth #qni2021
'I want to put a plea in for the carers who look after their loved ones. We are seeing carers being bypassed.' @AnnKeen11 at #qni2021
'I think we need a National Care Service which works hand in hand with the NHS. Community nursing has to be a key part of that, it won't work on the ground without that.' @JonAshworth #qni2021

'If you can provide people with personalised joined up care, keeping them in their home, you will save money because leaving people in hospital, costs billions. The systems aren't joined up. It's the patients themselves who lose out.' @JonAshworth #qni2021
'3 big challenges: 1. ageing population with great complexity of conditions; 2 .widening health inequalities; 3. huge backlog in care and infectious disease hasn't gone away.' @jonashworth #qni2021
'We've got to bring social care in line. When I was elected, the first enquiry, was what is social care and what is health care. We're still asking the same questions.' @AnnKeen11 #qni2021
'You've got a better understanding of nursing than any other politician I've ever come across!' @AnnKeen11 speaking to @JonAshworth at #qni2021

'I've got this big vision, starting with children, tackling obesity, mental health support, support people to stay well, in old age and the golden link? It's nursing! You cannot tackle these health inequalities without nursing at every step of the way.' @jonasthworth #qni2021

'These health inequalities are so endemic, a child born this second in poverty will live fewer years in good health, up to 20 years, compared to one born in richer areas. These inequalities start in childhood. We have to work on these!' @JonAshworth #qni2021

'There were monumental mistakes by the government on handling #covid. The fundamental issue as to why our response was so poor, 2 big things went wrong: 1. went into the crisis short of 40,000 nurses; 2. we allowed health inequalities to get wider and wider @JonAshworth #qni2021
'You have people abusing this title of nurse. I think we need to protect the title of nurse in law.' @JonAshworth at #qni2021 To view the current petition: https://t.co/nFgqZ3NNUd
'We need to make sure we take care of you too. And that is why I have asked @annkeen to work with me on this.' @jonashworth #qni2021

'What you have all been through must have felt like you've been to hell and back. Thank you for your dedication and your perseverance. We need to back you up and properly recognise you and make sure you have the well being support in the workplace too.' @jonashworth #qni2021 https://t.co/71GelIQomo

'Welcome to @JonAshworth the first Shadow Secretary of State for Health and Social Care to appoint a nursing advisor to his team, the first Shadow Secretary of State to attend a QNI conference: a real moment in time for us.' @CrystalOldman #qni2021

'All power to you, but we must support you. You are out there, knocking at that door, with the homeless, at the clinic. We can do it, we will do it together. I give you my full support in whatever way you want it.' @AnnKeen11 at #qni2021

'It is our duty to do things about what we see. To do what @michaelmarmot told us to do yesterday. Doing nothing, saying nothing is actually political. Because it looks like you agree.' @AnnKeen11 at #qni2021
'David Blunkett's dog decided to roll over and sigh and then did the loudest smelliest fart in living memory.  District Nursing prepared help me to keep my face neutral.' @AnnKeen11 at #qni2021

'I still want to be a District Nurse, it prepared me to be a minister. You never know what you're going to be faced with as a District Nurse and it was great preparation later on for me.' @AnnKeen11 at #qni2021

'I got the chance to work with Gordon Brown. One day I was sitting behind him and I heard him announce about fuel poverty and I was exceptionally proud to be there. What does poverty lead to? Ill health!' @AnnKeen11 at #qni2021 https://t.co/UJh2JJegkv
'How could I make a difference? I would speak up. I was brought up to stand up for the health service.' @AnnKeen11 at #qni2021 https://t.co/2Qhr8Iu0se
@AnnKeen11 at #qni2021 'In the 1980s I would visit my patients, they would say, 'I can't afford to put my heating on, it's my funeral money. Poverty was everywhere.' https://t.co/34ZVqQCFAj

'If we don't listen to those on the front line then very often the systems we put in place are not as responsive as we would like. I look forward to working with you all soon.' Great message of support from @mariacaulfield #qni2021
'The Health and Social care bill will make the system less bureaucratic and more accountable to the public.' @mariacaulfield at #qni2021

'We recognise to get people out of hospital we have to put resources in the community and the staff. Without you none of this is going to happen. We are on track to deliver 50,000 more nurses.' @mariacaulfield at #qni2021

Video message from @mariacaulfield at #qni2021 'I know first hand what huge amounts of work you've all put in in the past 12 to 18 months. You in the community have been keeping the show on the road. A big thank you to you, working tirelessly in very difficult circumstances' https://t.co/qUq5Nbyrp9
'We want you to get your mojo back and go back to work with a spring in your step. As we know that is very needed right now.' @CrystalOldman #qni2021

Thank you to @davidharewood for an incredibly inspiring session #qni2021 (saying thank you with BSL below) https://t.co/Q31a6awOKV

For centuries a certain way of thinking has taken hold, it'll take a lot of work for people to unlearn that and become true allies in the fight, because it's in the boardrooms, in the dressing rooms. The wider conversation has to happen in wider societies. @DavidHarewood #qni2021
'The more we can to create a safe space, where discussions can take place where people feel enabled and empowered to speak their truth and mind, the better.' @DavidHarewood #qni2021
#weathering the term for the daily toll that #racism has on your physical health @DavidHarewood #qni2021
'Trying to raise awareness about racism, is very very draining' @DavidHarewood #qni2021

'People don't want to hear that racism plays a role in any of these things. That denialism and shutting me down is very stressful so I can understand that people working saying they didn't feel safe, don't want to stand out or speak up.' @DavidHarewood #qnie2021

'Deprivation plays a part in the outcomes of people's health outcomes, poor areas tend to have cheaper housing, big main road near them, multiple occupancy where covid could easily spread.' @DavidHarewood #qni2021

@DavidHarewood 'One of the fundamental things within this question - Why is covid killing people of colour? - is that people of colour rarely feel they are listened to when they express their concerns.' #qni2021
'44% of NHS workforce are black and mixed ethnicity yet they made up 95% of the deaths of those working in the NHS.' @DavidHarewood #qni2021
'14% of England and Wales are black and mixed ethnicity, 34% of these were in intensive care with covid.' @DavidHarewood #qni2021

The QNI is committed to helping community nurses develop their knowledge and skills. We offer education grants of up to ¬£1000 to nurses seeking to undertake accredited courses for CPD, or post-registration top-up modules. For more info, visit: https://t.co/d5EZXSOfKL
3/3 For more information, please visit our website: https://t.co/jjTod4cqyi We believe that no nurse should be left to face these challenges alone.

2/3 If you or a colleague is worried about finances too, please get in touch, as we may be able to help. We have financial assistance specifically for community nurses who have been affected by the pandemic, and dedicated staff who can offer advice, in complete confidence.

1/3 We know that the pandemic continues to have a huge impact on nurses working in the community and social care. We hear of many nurses who are living with symptoms of Long Covid and we hear about others who are worn down and worried about physical and emotional burnout.
